intro: Cleistes vargasii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cleistes vargasii thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
